commitResults.messageBody:
About Us page does not contain updated info.

Reader will not be able to learn about us.

Edit the About Us page.

To update the About Us page.

Developer guide is outdated.

Readers may get confuede when reading.

Let's update the Developer Guide.

Readers can better understand the Developer Guide.

Developer guide is outdated.

Readers may be  misinformed.

Let's update the developer guide with current information.

Readers will be well informed.

Person does not have an organ field.

Users cannot add an organ to perons.

Let's add an organ field to person and edit aech instance of person.

Organ field will allow users to store critical information about
persons.

Current code has syntaxss errors.

Syntax errors will fail checkstyle test.

Let's fix the syntax.

Fixed syntax will pass checkstyle.

The Person class lacks a way to check if a donor's organ matches the
organ required by the Person.

User will not be able to match patients and donors.

Let's add an isMatch function to Person.

User will be able to check if organs match.

Persons do not have a blood type field.

Blood type is required to find a compatible donor.

Let's add a blood type field.

User will be able to match patients and donors more accurately.

Blood type field has bugs.

Program may have unintended behaviours.

Let's fix the bugs.

Program will function as intended.

BloodType and BloodTypeEnum classes have no tests.

May miss out on bugs and unexpected behaviours.

Let's add BloodTypeTest and BloodTypeEnumTest.

Can check for possible bugs.

Organ regex has bug.

It was failing test cases because it did not accept blank spaces.

Let's fix the regex.

To pass test cases.

Fails checkstyle test.

Code needs to be adjusted.

Lets fix checkstyle violations.

Code can pass checkstyle tests.

GUI lacks scroll.

Users have te resize application for long text fields.

Let's add a horizontal scroll.

User can read entire text field without resizing.

Help Gui has no scrollability.

Users have to manually resize to read text,
but they cant resize infinitely.

Let's add scrollability.

Users can scroll to read text.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Ui ---   layout: default.md   title: "User Guide"   pageNav: 3 ---
commitResults.messageBody:
**Organi-zer** is a **desktop application for the management of organ recipients in a hospital**. It is intended for **organ donation coordinators** who require easy, fast, and effective access to organ recipients during the time window that an organ is available for donation. If you are a coordinator for organ donation within a hospital or healthcare facility, **Organ-izer** allows you to: * **Easily** view your list of potential organ recipients, complete with emergency contact details, blood type, and priority. * **Efficiently** manage a database of potential organ recipients. * **Organ-izer** uses a **Command Line Interface** (CLI), which means that all functions of the application are accessible via typed commands. * If you can type fast, **Organ-izer** can coordinate organ donation much faster than traditional mouse-based applications. * **Securely** store information about users locally without external internet connection. **Organ-izer** is based on the existing AddressBook Level 3 (AB3) project, and is optimized for the time-critical environment under which organ donation occurs in a hospital. If you wish to navigate this page quickly, feel free to use the **table of contents** on the right -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Ensure you have Java `17` or above installed in your Computer.
You can **check your Java version** by following [this guide](#https://www.java.com/en/download/help/version_manual.html).
How to install Java `17`: [Windows](https://se-education.org/guides/tutorials/javaInstallationWindows.html) | [Mac](https://se-education.org/guides/tutorials/javaInstallationMac.html) | [Linux](https://se-education.org/guides/tutorials/javaInstallationLinux.html) 1. Download the latest version of **Organ-izer** from [here](https://github.com/AY2526S1-CS2103T-T17-3/tp/releases). You should find a file named `organ-izer.jar` in your downloads. 1. Make a folder and place `organ-izer.jar` into it. 1. If Java `17` is correctly installed, double-clicking `organ-izer.jar` should launch the application.
A screen similar to the one below should be visible after a few seconds. Note that the app contains some sample data.

![Ui](images/Ui.png)

1. To start, try typing `list` in the command box at the top. **If it is your first time using the application, it will not display any data**. 1. To add a new user, try typing ` add n/Alice Pauline p/94351253 e/alice@example.com a/123, Jurong West Ave 6, #08-111 o/kidney b/O+ r/1 t/friends ` 1. A list of other commands you can try: * `list` : Lists all patients. * `clear` : Deletes all patients. * `exit` : Exits the app. 1. `Organ-izer` has many other useful commands to help with donation coordination. Details about all available commands can be found in the [Features](#features) section below.

commitResults.messageTitle: Convert find command to stricter search
Add search by blood type command

commitResults.messageBody:
There is no way to search for persons by priority.

This means that a user is unable to perform database checks or
maintain the organ recipient priority distribution if they
wish to do so.

Let's add a predicate that can be used to filter persons by
priority.

It is done as a separate predicate so I can use it for a search
command in the future.

Implementation is similar to the blood type predicate.

Priority search has a predicate but no associated command.

This means that the priority predicate is inaccessible.

Let's add the priority command to expose this predicate to the user.

Doing so allows the user to organise the database better.

Implementation is similar to BloodTypeCommand.

There is no parser for the implemented priority command.

This means the command is present but inaccessible to the user.

Let's add a parser for the priority command and register it in
the main address book parser.

Implementation is similar to BloodTypeParser.

User Guide is missing features section.

This means the user has no clue about available features.

Let's add a features sections with available commands.

Similar format to AB3.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add class relationships for class diagram
commitResults.messageBody:
Class diagram is missing some class dependencies.

It doesn't correctly represent the relationship between classes.

Let's add the relevant relationships to the class diagram.

The diagram will require more updates in the future.
Add class relationships for class diagram

Recipients of the same name cannot be added to the address book.

Hospitals may deal with patients with identical names, and this
would result in an issue.

Let's identify users uniquely by their name and phone numbers.

Doing so allows children who might not have phone numbers to be
tagged to their parents' numbers instead.

Names with extra whitespaces are recognised as unique,
eg. "John Doe" vs "John  Doe".

This can result in duplicate and invalid names.

Let's reduce all whitespaces to a single character before checking
for duplicate names.

This also avoids tab and other special space characters.

The addressbook recognises and stores lowercase bloodtypes.

They do not appear during bloodtype searches as it is case sensitive.

Let's convert all bloodtypes to uppercase during entry to avoid the
issue.

Existing lowercase bloodtypes in an addressbook will be udpated.

Priority command is missing whitespaces after command word.

Users may be confused by the error message and raise issues.

Let's fix the command format.

Also included information about valid priority numbers.

Priority command uses error message of persons listing.

The message it displays is incoherent and has incorrect grammar.

Let's create a new error message for it that helps the user more.

Referring to priorities as "list of priorities" avoids plurality
issues.

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, users have to manually key in all prefixes when using add command to add a new recipient.

This results in tediousness in keying in new recipients and spends time which should be saved in this context of quickly finding a recipient for an organ donor.

Let us create a tab key press feature that sets up all the prefixes for the add command.

Now the user does not have to key in prefixes manually and can save time when adding recipients to the directory.
Add tab completion functionality for add command
Update User Guide with all commands
